Reviews.Title: “Only location is good”
Reviews.Author: dawn H
Reviews.Content: Good location near to the station with local shop out to the right round the corner and in two days we walked to all the sites (exhausted at the end though) some nice restaurants nearby. Check in was easy enough even though there was language barrier. Breakfast was atrocious and we left after trying the juice. I would like to add that we have travelled extensively in all ranges of hotels and only wanted somewhere to sleep and shower so we are not fussy. BUT and this is a big one we had no hot water but carried on as it was early and figured everyone was prob using it. We returned in the evening to more of the same. I went to speak to staff and he didn't give a crap and told me it was tough. This was after he did something with the fuse board. I returned to my room prepared for another cold shower and after 5 or so mins the water was warm!! Clearly they isolate the hot water to save money and only turn it on if you complain?? Another cold shower the next morning. I don't have an issue with a business trying to save money but I do with being spoken to like an idiot! It is basic and having seen the abundance of hotels in the same road I wouldn't recommend it. It was barely adequate for us a we are a couple who travelled with one carry on for the two of us so you can appreciate we are not high maintenance. On another note be aware of what your paying for in cafes we got over charged even when standing at the service bar. Happy travelling peeps x

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing too special.”
Reviews.Author: Ana C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a quiet street near Termini station. This is the main advantage. I also loved that the people were really friendly and ready to help you anytime. I received a few maps and indications in order to get to the main attractions. The rooms were small, but who cares? I was there to visit Rome, not to stay in the hotel all day long. I had a little problem with the breakfast because there wasn't any ham, cheese or vegetables to eat. For 4 days i ate only croissants. Another advantage was that i could walk to the colosseum and other attractions on foot and I was there in about 15 min. So I recommend it if you want to explore the Rome and if you don't have problems with the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous bed”
Reviews.Author: NikiOxford
Reviews.Content: We don`t go back again! - We checked in, got our key, then we went up to our room and we realized that the room was not ready. We were not upset because it happened before 1 o`clock but we were surprised that the receptionist forgot to inform us that the room was not ready. -We have stayed in a triple room, so our third bed was placed into a twin room. our extra bed was sooo dangerous, its legs were flexible, it seemed that any time it could collapse. so my friend could not sleep at all. -the breakfast was really sweet...no ham, no cheese, no fruits, only sweet pastries...however the coffee was nice and unlimited...don`t try the orange juice! the toilet was next to the breakfast room, it was really smelly! -When we checked out, we realized that we were charged for drinks from the mini bar...we haven`t drink anything at all...we told the receptionist that we did not have those drinks, he started to calling his colleagues then he told us that we had them. we told him again that we did not! finally after a little argument we got back our money without saying sorry. Positive things: -good location -luggage store free of charge -friendly night porter -clean room

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy K
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. Their website says the staff are multilingual. Not true except for one staff member who can speak english, but he only worked one shift during our stay. The rest of the staff were totally unhelpful. As for the rooms, not too bad for a budget hotel. They were clean & fairly comfortable. Unfortunately we were given a room where the heating didnt work at all - NOT GOOD DURING A EUROPEAN WINTER. It was absolutely freezing. No extra blankets were available. When we tried to explain to the staff, they explained that the heating is only turned on between 6am-9am and then 9pm-midnight. What sort of hotel is this?? It was only after making a scene at the front desk while others were checking in that they agreed to give us a different room where the heating worked. (still only 6hrs a day). I was in Rome 12months ago and stayed at hotel Caravaggio. I should have stayed there this time again! The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front office staff terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sadeck
Reviews.Content: Staff at the reception was rude.rooms very poor.practically no hot water.breakfast ok.overall poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!Really helpful staff :)”
Reviews.Author: Maria H
Reviews.Content: My mam, my sister and myself are just back from Rome 26.11.11.We arrived at 1pm and were able to check in our room was just ready. We had a triple room.Have to be honest after i had booked this hotel i seen more reviews, bad ones and was like i hope this place is alright,but we were pleasantly surprised I imagined our room to be a tiny box, as some of the reviews had said that and the bathroom but the room was fine there was a double bed and a single plenty of space for us, the bathroom also had plenty of space, i did notice one person in reception saying she had no hot water and i think she had been moved to another room already and still no hot water.but you just have to let the shower run for about 3 mins then the waters lovely and hot.There was also a mini bar in our room,tv with sky and hairdryer in the bathroom and also a safe in the wardrobe.As for breakfast i already had said to my mam and sister look the reviews on brekkie are really bad,When we went down our first mornin we got lovely fresh cold orange juice they also had cranberry juice. They had 2 cereals which i didint have as i dont drink milk but every1 else there seemed to like it.There was croissants and these little pastrys with jam i had them every morning they were lovley.It was a grand breakfast to start u off for the day, also a coffee machine you could get different coffees think my mam had the cappucino and she said it was lovely.Only thing was when you look at the hotel terminal website it says 35 rooms smoking and non smoking and most with balconys so we requested a smoking but when we got there were informed its all non smoking and our room had no balcony we were on the third floor i dont know if any of them have but the website did say subject to availability.Staff were really helpful throughout our stay free maps at reception and they mark places on the map if you wanted to see them.They told us about mamma mia that was on and we went to see it it was brill even though it was in Italian but we enjoyed it.Location is excellent when you come out of the hotel go left then next right then your at termini station.We only went here once as first day we got on a train my mams bag a girl tried to get her hand into her bag twice only for my sister seen her but it was a scary experience in that station we practically ran out if it!There all over the place them pickpockets.Especially the train station is crawling with them ready to pounce.So we decided safest way round Rome was the sightseeing bus we went with glt (green line tours)which is straight up from the hotel 17euro for the day or 21euro for 24hours brings you to Colosseum, Vatican city, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and 6 other spots,and SAFE,Beware of them people dressed up as Romans at the Colosseum they will be like we will take a photo and then try to demand 20euro off you ha!!Even though they take it with your camera but you just give them a euro or whatever you want but not 20euro.But if i went back to Rome i would stay in the Hotel Terminal again :) Maria Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Bad ! Don't use it !”
Reviews.Author: ApostolosG
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, NOT hot water but a few hours ! And for breakfast is better not mentioned at all !

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable location but Never again.”
Reviews.Author: londongirl295
Reviews.Content: The location has to be the only thing that i can say is pretty good. right near the train station, buses and taxis and your surrounded in other hotels, shops etc but its like being in the middle of chinatown/pakistan, im not racist but theyr just wasnt no english in sight except me n my partner. was worse than living in london. The breakfast wasnt really brilliant, 2 types of cereal - cheap version of cornflakes and choco balls, about 4 types of bread which were stale and crossaints, the tea/coffee was awful as came out of the machine cold, they only provided UHT milk, and supplied a very cheap version of orange. The pictures on the website of the rooms are SOOOO misleading!! my room was the tinest hotel room iv ever seen, my bedroom at home is bigger than the hotel room and en suite put together!! theres no space around the bed, no where to put your suitcase or anything. and the shower was mega tiny, even with the shower curtain around the floor was flooded, had to resort to washing my hair over the sink because there was no room whatsoever! when i used the hairdryer it blew out dust which meant me having to rewash my hair! They wasnt much hot water, was lukewarm. i was hoping to have a kettle supplied in the room, not even one of them was provided. The staff weren't very nice at all, there was only one nice man who checked us in and was helpful and friendly but the rest was rude and demanding! Even when you spoke to some of them they kept there head down and didnt even acknowledge you! the lift was tiny, never seen one so small. you couldnt take your hotel key out so it meant having to wait in a queue just to get your key when someone in front of you was taking forever. There is charges for everything such as 3euros per hour for the internet in the lobby, wireless internet was expensive, the mini bar id recommend not to touch as you could pop to the shop around the corner and get the same supplies for half the price. room service is 5euros at a time. was fairly clean but the room wasnt cleaned daily, nor were towels etc replaced daily. Was certainly not a nice place to be, would never go again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: FabianaDD
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights to visit Rome. Rooms are clean and have lots of space, a mini fridge, a safe but no coffee and tea facilities. The bathroom also had a lot of space. Internet was not available for free, not even in the lobby. Breakfast was continental, only toast, butter, jams, cereals and milk. There is a coffee machine you can use but if you want expressos you have to pay extra. The woman in charge of breakfast was a bit rude, one morning she came in at 10:10 and told everyone that breakfast was served UNTIL 10 o´clock, and she turned off the lights. Not nice from the staff to do that sort of thing. The man at the front desk at night was really nice and helpful. One excellent thing is the location, it is 3 blocks away from TERMINI train station and tube station. From the airport, you can take the train into Termini station and there are also shuttles that take about an hour to get into Termini but cost half of the train fare. And there are also loads of busses near. You can take a bus or the tube to go anywhere in Rome. It is an OK hotel, should do something about the rude staff and the Internet connection. They should at least provide it for free in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Terminal Hotel fir three nights from the 22 to 25 of March and it was my first trip to Rome. The rooms are small but this us not unusual for a city centre hotel but it was very clean and comfortable. The towels were changed every day and the room cleaned daily too. There was a flat screen TV with Sky tv and a really good shower. There were certainly no bed bugs as an earlier review said, intact, the bed was so comfortable I wish I could have taken it home. Breakfast was served in a room in the basement and was fine, ok nit bacon and eggs but enough to set you up for the morning and better than some I have had in Paris if you want a comparison. The reception staff were very helpful and informative though busy. On my last day I was invited to leave my bag in a locked room whilst I went for a last look round and I was told I could use a bathroom in the basement on my return. The area is a bit rough at first sight bur this is normal for areas near main station now, just look at Kings Cross in London. although obviously virtually blind I had no problems when walking around but just be aware. You are very close to the tourist sight seeing buses, about 7 minutes walk away and the metro is nearby too. Also of note is Alfredos Resturaunt, virtually opposite the hotel which is also very friendly, the waiter spoke excellent English when my Italian faltered and you can get a good three course Italian meal for 20 euros but there is a NacDonalds near the station if funds are short. To sum up, the hotel is good, clean and safe. Be aware when walking around but you are not under siege just because you are a tourist and enjoy yourself. Would I go back to this hotel? I certainly will. Howe

Reviews.Title: “Good location but....... breakfast and cleanliness of room lets it down”
Reviews.Author: Mareee17
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights - great location and staff on reception very friendly. However, breakfast was really poor, UHT milk, luke warm drinks from drink machine, orange squash masquerading as orange juice, crispbread and slices of stale croissants. Wasn't expecting a banquest but fresh tea/coffee, juice and maybe toast/croissants/fresh fruit would be a great improvement. Towels were not changed for duration of stay and room was grubby with floor covered in dust.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and Rude People”
Reviews.Author: BaconBreath
Reviews.Content: I am sorry, but nothing is worse than bed bugs - I really don't need to say much more...but the rooms were really dirty, and the staff did not seem at all concerned by this. I only had one nice person, which was the one who checked me in, and after that...not a single smile - they even joke that they are the ones giving good reviews here (the STAFF). They promote breakfast, which consists of nothing but stale bread...thats it! And to really top it off - only luke warm water for your shower - they keep it down to save on their cost. The wifi is also very expensive. Awful hotel that could really do well with their location...if they only cared to try.

Reviews.Title: “sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: albioncafetrader
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a very good base for sightseeing in Rome. Although there are thousands of restaurants in the heart of the city( expensive ) we found panini's ( beautiful sandwiches in crspy bread ) were enough for lunchtime. For a good priced and excellent meal in the evening we ate at La Mensa de Bacco which is in the same street as the hotel ( 1 minute walk, handy if raining ) Very popular with locals and one of the few in Rome that do not have a tout outside shoving a menu in your face. No need to. Alfredos opposie the Hotel was the cheapest place we found for beer. Quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expect of 3* accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JHB_10
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. This does not compare with other city 3* hotels we have used. The accommodation is listed as having been refurbished yet our room- with 3 single beds- was poor in al aspects; dated, tired and not as clean as expected. No evodence of any refurbishment and given we had booked a standard double we were not happy. The breakfasts were poor and the only upside was its location. Would we recommend/stay here again- a definite NO!

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to all the main turistic...”
Reviews.Author: bronxalicious
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to all the main turistic places, very close to the train station an metro. This Hotel is placed in a large and always "alive" street so very safe at all times (only a little bit noisy at night but this is quite common in Rome) The only negative point is the breakfast as there is a very small choice. Rooms are quite small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness and service standards need improvement”
Reviews.Author: Ricky00007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Terminal for 2 nights. Apart from being near Termini station and Rome landmarks, I must say that this hotel doesn't offer much. The room we had was very disappointing for a so-called "3-star hotel". Plus, their website mentions that the hotel has been refurbished. First, it was very small, the bed had dirty Kleenex (tissues) under it, only a flat sheet covered the bed (not a fitted sheet) so we found ourselves right on the mattress the next morning. The carpet is outdated and dirty. Secondly, the bathroom smelt cat urine..big time! The shower had mildew all over. The shower head spilt water not only from its extremity but from its sides. The faucet was dirty and sticky during our 2-day stay. Finally, the cherry on the sundae, during our second night the air conditionning stopped working or was switched off. The temperature outside was around 30 Celsius. Really, there is a lot of improvement to be done here. Someone needs to put on his pants and supervises the cleaning done in this hotel and guests' satisfaction should be checked prior their departure. I will definitely warn my travel agency to be vigilant before suggesting this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DHarrold
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a very comfortable, roomy hotel. The location was great, and the staff was friendly. If you are planning on lots of sight seeing being this close to Termini works great. We read that the subway in Rome was mainly for suburban commuters and not that valuable to tourists. We found that completely wrong and used the subway a great deal. Was wonderful to be within two blocks of our hotel after a long day of sight seeing. We also found the neighborhood to be fine. There are many nice casual resturants very near the hotel. Santa Maria Maggorie is a must see church and is only a few blocks from the hotel and attracts lots of tourists, and hence nice places to eat. As far as the hotel, the bathroom was quite roomy, similar to a hotel in the USA. Had satellite TV with some English speaking channels so we spent just a few moments seeing what was going on in the world. We had a corner room and so the street noise was very loud. But we had the windows open and were so tired we could have slept through any amount of noise. The breakfast was OK, but had better at other Italian hotels. We would stay there again without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Terminal = The worst choice”
Reviews.Author: sway1982
Reviews.Content: This trip was ours ideal moment, but when we arrived at Terminal hotel... The dream disappeared... The room was too small, was too dirty... The carpet was black, probably the cause was not to see, how dirty it was... The bathroom was also too small, that you can shower and brush your teeth at the same time... I have no words about the view... I have to notice that we closed all the windows, cause we were afraid not only the thieves but the cockroaches also! I'm pretty sure that they lived there, but I couldn't see them in the black carpet... The breakfast room was too small also! How pattern, of course!!! At the same time you eat your breakfast (= toasted bread, butter, marmalade, croissant, that's it! ), a lady appears with a bin... She places the bin at the chairs,(the same that you eat, of course!), and she collects the used plates... Hygiene is an unknown word to this hotel... The recepionist couldn't speak english so we had to play the pantomime every time we needed something... I have to say that they was indifferent and impolite also... Finally, I have to say one thing... If you have a strange friend/ boss/ ex-partner and you hate him/her, send them immediately at Terminal hotel for leisure...

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: takis757
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 days vacation in Rome , and I must say that this hotel was what I was looking for: 1.Very close to Rome Central Terminal Train Station ( A bit noisy I have to admit) 2.Very close to both metro lines station 3.Just 10--30 min. away from most popular sightseeings 4.Most important very reasonable price € 200-240 for early booking On the other hand the room was a bit small ,the batroom quite clean , no good breakfast ,very very hot heating system--turned on almost all day , and a bit strange neighbourhood with lots of immigrants though I did not notice any problems... So if you are or feel young and you prefer spending your money in shopping rather than paying for a luxurious hotel Termini Hotel is an excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “cheap, cheerful and clean”
Reviews.Author: shawror
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The staff were friendly and helpful giving directions. The rooms are basic, but as we were not staying a lot of time in our room (basically just to sleep) this did not bother any of our group. We all felt we were in an ideal location we easily managed the sights as all were in easy access. As for a bad area at night time, none of our group found this (including very late). I would say if your looking for somewhere clean and just to wash and sleep then it's ideal as the rooms are not equipped with loads of space, although we had fantastic wardrobe space, a double and single bed. We hope to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too happy!”
Reviews.Author: righttoanna
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome in May and it was terribly hot. Hotel Terminal did not have their airconditioning turned on and the streets were too noisy to leave the windows opened. That definitely made the stay unpleasant even though the location is great and the rooms are clean. Most members of the staff are polite, but we did have one really nasty manager.

Reviews.Title: “the reviews here must be about another Terminalhotel.”
Reviews.Author: fingerslea
Reviews.Content: Just spent a great week at the Terminal hotel.My room was spotless.The employees were all polite and helpfull.The manager went out of his way to guide us with bus and metro tips. The nonsense about being afraid to walk about at night is baloney.I am 80 years old and had no problem walking about .We ate each night at one of the restaurants on the street.The only suggestion I could make is that they should get rid of the coffee machine in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: connor200
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Terminal Hotel in July 08 during big European holiday. The location is superb, right in the middle of the tourist action. The hotel is very close to the Termini Train station which was very handy - I'd say less than 5 minutes walk and you're there. Was a little apprehensive when booking this hotel based on the reviews I had read and unfortunately many of them were exactly the same as my experience. The hotel is pretty old and needs a renovation quite badly. We stayed on the 5th floor and thankfully there is a working elevator. Was quite shocked at just how small the room was - there was nowhere for our cases to go and the bathroom was the smallest I've ever seen. Cleanliness wasn't great but it wasn't the worst I've seen. Shower was so small you couldn't really turn around with the door closed and the water was constantly tepid. I didn't mind this too much given it was the middle of summer. The room was stayed in didn't look like the photo's we had seen but I guess they must exist on another floor. The included breakfast was awful but there are loads of great places to eat nearby anyway. Overall the hotel was pretty disappointing but the location and price were right and you don't go to Rome to stay in your hotel room! My advice though, don't go in the intense July heat - it certainly slows down your site seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: macred67
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just the one night at the Terminal on my way back home. Giving it just 2 out of 5 might seem a bit mean as it was clean, in a fairly good location with courteous English speaking staff. However, as a Scot in the Mediterranean in June, I need air condition, which was working fine when I arrived and then goes off at midnight, just when I need it if I want to sleep. Add to that, the boiler failed overnight and we had no hot water for a shower. So, no refreshing wake up soak after a sweaty night. We did mention both these problems. The problem with trhe boiler was a maintenance issue and met with a shrug. We were advised that due to energy saving rules, they were not allowed to run the airconditioning between midnight and 1pm. Funny that the 2 star hotel we stayed in the week before only 200 meters away could run the air conditioning all day. There was no adequate bar in the hotel, the carpets needed replacing and the windows did not cut out the noise of the city (very close to Termini Station). It seems they claim to be a 3 star hotel as the rooms have a mini bar. Doesn't do it for me. This is a fairly shabby 2 star hotel and I would avoid it. Try the nearby 2 star Hotel Santa Prassede instead.

Reviews.Title: “Decent base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: pointy0001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel and were looking for a base for sightseeing at a reasonable price. It is in a really good location, right next to the train station and a short walk to the Metro. If you enjoy walking round cities as my wife and I do then many of the main sights are walkable. We arrived in the late afternoon and having booked a double room, were given what was basically a single room with a double bed shoehorned in. There was barely any room to walk around the bed and nowhere to put suitcases etc. The shower was tiny and barely big enough for me to fit in. It was on the first floor and very noisy at night. Other reviews make mention of the the grumpy night receptionist and he wasn't particularly helpful in moving us, but did pass our request on to the day shift who did move us to another room, which was much bigger and had a small balcony overlooking the street on floor five, which was much quieter. This room was in need of a lick of paint, but was clean and was a decent sized room. The shower screen was broken but usuable. The staff were generally helpful and friendly and spoke good English and even the grumpy night man spent quite some time on the phone for us trying to get a taxi on a stormy night. Breakfast is the usual continental affair and if things sometimes ran out, the staff would happily replenish these when asked. If you are looking for a base only, and your expectations aren't too high, then this hotel might be for you. If I went back to Rome I would try elsewhere next time. Our guidebook spoke worryingly about the area the hotel was in, however, we found the area to be absolutely fine and the street it is on consists mainly of hotels, shops and restaurants. On the subject of restaurants, avoid the tourist areas - expensive and mediocre quality and get a taxi into the suburbs to a 'local' restaurant. Half the price and twice the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch. Go to next door instead., Igea.”
Reviews.Author: sweetmarie_7
Reviews.Content: I read the mixed reviews about the Hotel Terminal, but was optimistic as it had supposedly been renovated and offered the fifth night free. Perhaps it was because I was a single traveller that I was put in room 503- and maybe all the '03' rooms had the same problem- but apart from the beautiful window, it was awful. A double bed had been put in and there was little room for anything else least of all luggage! It seemed that the marks along the walls were testimony to the variety of ways previous visitors had tried to 'store' their suitcases etc. The bathroom was ok tho' the shower was extremely small and it's sliding doors were falling to pieces no doubt because people over 90lbs had tried to shower there! The free packaged slippers were a necessity as the carpet was filthy I was sure the floor had never been vaccuumed, and how could it? No room to swing a cat let alone a vaccuum. I stayed the five nights but the rude, unwilling and unhelpful gallic- shrugging male night receptionist, compelled my inner sanity to seek help from the Hotel Igea next door. There, the staff were so nice and helpful, the place looked so good, and the eating area was on the main floor and very pleasantly laid out.. So I asked the price and immediately booked myself in for the following Saturday ( after my stay in the Cinque Terre) prior to flying back to Canada. It was a joy. My single room really was meant for a single. The place was tiled , spotless and very attractive. The shower was larger and therefore in excellent condition and the TV worked! The breakfast offered an abundance of breads and sweet rolls already in a basket and on the table, plus the coffee was real, not from a machine, but delivered to your table by a blazered staffmember. I paid 70 euros for this, inclusive of breakfast, in contrast to the $118 I would have had to pay at the Terminal. In addition I saw that there was a special deal offered online if a person stayed several nights, but I'd missed that treat. Incidentally. I'm a 67 year old lady who walked easily from the railway station with my bag and 4 wheel suitcase, approx. 4 mins.

Reviews.Title: “La Bella Roma”
Reviews.Author: Roma1018
Reviews.Content: Ciao everyone, this is the most comfortable yet affordable hotel you could ever ask for, not only is it close to all neccessary amenties it literally a stone throw away from our favourite place of visit the Coloseoum, an absolute pleasure staying in this for our short duration, at first we were a little sceptical when we booked this hotel due to the mixed reviews as can be apparent from above, rest assured staying here was an absolute pleasure, the staff are welcoming, the cleansiness star 100%, breakfast is continental therefore much healthier then the usual english back home, last but not least the place itself is maginificent, highly recommend you book guide tours as this is the best way to visit and enjoy Roma. Overall a great experience which should not be missed in this lifetime, should we visit again Hotel Terminal keep our room waiting ;0) Mile Grazie

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, was more than expected”
Reviews.Author: foodsgettincold
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews from various websites and it came out the best. When we arrived and checked in the guy at reception asked if we liked heights. We said yes and so he moved us to the top floor into a nicer room with a balcony. The room was very impressive for the money we paid. i wasnt expecting too much for a 3 star but it was immaculate, great sized double bed, everything was sparkling clean, lovely windows and glass doors, laminate floors and tv. We had chocolates on our bed and the bathroom was all marble looking and really clean too. We did have a little problem with the hot water, i think each time we wanted to shower we had to call the receptionist to do something to the water which was a bit of a pain but it didnt ruin anything. i would definantly recommend this hotel. The breakfast was basic but nice. Standard cereals, bread and sweat breads available. Tea and coffee machine and juice. All very nice surroundings though, it was enough to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: jntclem
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally situated, 3 mins walk from termini station, showers are hit and miss, sometimes you get hot water, and "shower curtain" was a leaky plastic mess and rooms are uber basic. If you can get a cheap deal, and only use the place to sleep you won't be dissapointed. Staff helpful and friendly. The best thing is location from termini station as you can hop on the metro and get anywhere in rome. Explore, explore, explore! So much to see! x x

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: NeitiMatkailija
Reviews.Content: Considering that this hotel claims to be a three-star hotel, I was very disappointed in my stay. The infrastructure could have been OK, but dirty bathroom, one bed instead of twin beds that we paid for, non-functioning elevator (room in 5th floor) and a poorly arranged breakfast really don't fit my idea of an OK hotel. Most disappointed I was in one of the receptionists, who was very rude towards us and never apologized his appalling behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “Brava Terminal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaggiForte
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, close to any and all transportation..walking was easy to Termini, many wonderful trattorias and ristorante with reasonable prices in the neighborhood. We had a nice corner room overlooking the park, which while it was noisy at night (we were in Rome, after all) was very clean and comfortable...with REAL bathtowels, not those flimsy bathsheets found in most European hotels. The staff was friendly and very accommodating, the continental breakfast was both fresh and complete..on one occasion the woman in charge of the rooms made an apple torte for the guests...I would love to have that cappuccino machine in my kitchen. We felt safe walking at night, there was someone on the desk 24/7...the only problem was the noise from the street, something they cannot control. We would definitely rebook

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SarahDJDerby
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome for 3 nights. The hotel was nothing special but it did the job. The bedding and towels were changed daily and the room was kept fairly clean. The decor was pretty dull and the room’s very small but if you’re planning to spend alot of time in them then perhaps Rome is not the place for you. The shower cubicle was small and the door was broken but we always had hot water which was the most important thing after a days sightseeing. The hotel was ideally located about 5 mins from termini station which is great if it’s your first time in Rome. I would not say the location was seedy as the streets are lined with tourist restaurants and at no point did I feel threatened. The thing to bear in mind is that this is a hotel in the centre of Rome and you will get what you pay for. I was quite happy with the breakfast which consisted of cereal, toast, pastries, coffee and fruit juice. I would say that if you are looking for a buget hotel in the centre of Rome in a great location for exploring - and you dont mind very basic accomodation, then Hotel Termini is absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Use This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmydoda
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst Hotel i have ever experienced. We were there for a 4 day break and expected at least basic cleanliness and food. What we got was staff that told lies, staff that offered no help, a room that was filthy and food that was truly awful. For the duration of the stay we had NO hot water at all. A dribble of cold. Constant excuses and nothing in the way of assiatance from the staff. One guest was left with no blankets after complaining that the hotel maid had not replaced the blanket after cleaning the room. The Numpty on the desk, would do nothing until the next day. he completely refused to offer assistance. Whatever you do, under no circumstances, book a room at this hotel. Take a tent, sleep in the park, do anything but stay here. Rome was fabulous. There are hundreds of hotels. Choose this one last.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: RevillJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Terminal for 4 nights in August, a well located hotel easy access for all the tourist areas. The room was very small, shower leaked and the water was not always hot. The breakfast was very poor, didn’t bother to go again after the first day we went to some café/bar locally. I wouldn't rate the hotel terrible but it was more a 2 star not 3, it was OK for 4 nights but I wouldn’t stay there again, I thought the price was high for the standards that I received.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - in fact, pretty bad!”
Reviews.Author: drunkenmaster42
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the staff were helpful and reasonably friendly and the beds were clean. On the downside, the lock on the door was broken and required a hell of a lot of wriggling to get it to work, the shower leaked like mad, there were no carpets (it was all horrid lino throughout - a deathtrap when the shower leaked!) and the room was really, really small and narrow. OK, I peeked into some of the doubles and they looked a bit better but the singles were nasty. One other word of caution - there's a restaurant over the road and they often have musicians playing the accordian for a few minutes every hour up until about 9-10 in the evening. It's not TOO invasive, but be warned.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job!”
Reviews.Author: Bufyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my girlfriend for 3 days mid march. I booked my stay at the Hotel Terminal prior to seeing any reviews, so upon reading them after my initail booking i was quite nervous that i had made a terrible mistake. However! Let me dispell any of these myths that other people have said about the area being unsafe. Absolute nonsense. Its a very busy area no more than 200 meters to the main rome trainstation, which makes it not only buzzing with activity, but also very very useful for your stay in rome. Even an nights the area is fine, its just a busy area when all the shops and little restaurants are closed. The hotel itself upon first sight seemed ok, building was fine and neon lights worked! The lobby area was completely under renovation when we went, so there was very little else in there except the reception desk, and tools in the corner that the buliders and plasterers were using. The elevator was tiny, and as it didnt arrive we took the stairs. Each floor appeared to be under differerent stages of renevation, and then 3rd floor, (our floor) was recently completed. The room was basic but all new, bathroom was fine and all water was hot etc. televison worked but we had to get a remote from reception. Breakfast was pretty poor, cereal and a croissant in a wrapper. It had a coffee machine that made ok coffees, but i was suprised they didnt make their own. they also had a juice machine. Staff were always friendly whenever we spoke to them or asked anything of them. In summary, this hotel when finished will be a good cheap stay, with everything you need. when finished. At the moment i would steer clear of it for at least 3 months and give it a chance to be completed. If though, like me, you have already booked and are reading reviews in horror, have no fear, for all will be well, its not an 'ok' hotel for a reasonable price, in an awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Very old and very, very dirty”
Reviews.Author: Guipa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old but the worst part is the cleaning. They don´t clean the rooms. I advice the reception that my room it´s full of dust and they only clean the 3 places that I mention, all the rest stay dirty. The breakfast is only a coffee machine and cakes from the day before.

Reviews.Title: “cold and empty”
Reviews.Author: jackieandmike
Reviews.Content: Whilst it is relatively cheap and near to the local bus and train stations, the hotel is for the less discerning traveller. The decor was tired and shabby, the main hotel sign had been damaged and was not working. The bed linen and towels were clean, the toilet / shower were not as clean as they could have been. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room and it is only possible to get a hot drink between 7am and 2 pm according to one of the less helpful staff members, but most of the staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was dry and unappealing, we had to eat in our room as work was taking place in the breakfast room. We found that the airconditioning/heating did not work during the afternoon and as it had been raining and we were wet, it was difficult to dry our selves and clothing and it was uncomfortably cold. Would we return to the Hotel Terminal? NO.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shearerno9
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at the Hotel Terminal Rome for a mini break for their 49th wedding anniversary and were a little bit worried on reading the reviews. However, when they arrived they said that although the hotel was no frills, the hotel was spotlessly clean with good clean beds and a lovely bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the continental breakfast was very good. The hotel is close to the bus and rail station and is within walking distance of Rome's main tourist attractions. Also there is an excellent restaurant 50 metres from the hotel called La Mensa di Bacco and is excellent value for money. They also felt completely safe in that area even at night. The only downside my Father said is that there was some traffic noise but my parents would both stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Sweet Little Hotel With a View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a lovely little room with a small balcony overlooking the street and restaurants below. Situated near the train station and the Basilica of St. Mary Major, it is perfectly located to many major sites. The breakfast wasn't anything to write home about, but the staff was very courteous and helpful. I would definitely book a room at this hotel again and will recommend it to others. It certainly isn't a 5 Star hotel, but the beds were comfortable, the view from the window balcony nice and the staff wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beds Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this hotel. Small rooms, sheets not clean, beds where cots.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay... but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed at this hotel for the weekend on our first trip to Rome. Our room was okay - it was basic but then I was expecting that from the price. However the en suite was lovely. It's literally 2 minutes away from the train station and I would agree with the other reviews in that the location was seedy as there was a porn shop along the street and some not very nice looking cafes. However the area seemed quite mixed - some really nice looking hotels right next door to some where maybe you wouldn't want to stay. It's definately not a hotel where I would wish to spend a good part of the day, but it's alright for touching base - somewhere if you're just looking to crash for the night and spend the day sight seeing. If you are looking for a more upmarket hotel in a more secure area I would suggest nearer the Spanish Steps. The area seems nicer and it's still within walking distance to most of the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms, seedy location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked this hotel in the UK before travelling and was told that it was a nice hotel. It really should not have a three star rating. The room we were allocated was very shabby: the chair covers were ripped, as was the end of the bed, which had no valance to cover it; the pillows were disgusting and very yellow; there was a hole in the curtains and the curtain pull didn't work; there was no remote control for the TV; there were holes in the wall where something had come off and not been put back; the trim on the lampshades was hanging off; the walls were very knocked about and grubby. We complained to the man at reception, who was nice, and were offered another room. This was in a similar shabby state so we refused to stay there and managed to get an upgrade to another hotel after calls to the UK. The location of the Terminal Hotel is seedy and we would not have felt safe walking there at night.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Terminal
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo, 103, 00185 Rome, Italy
